word:
Lucinda, how apt we are to look to ourselves trying to hunt up some worthiness in us to make us acceptable to God, or else to bemoan that lack of worthiness we are so anxious to find. Jesus invites us to come just as we are although polluted with sin. We cannot make ourselves better. It is more pleasing to God for us to come to Him just as we are in our helplessness, in 


                                     -433- 

our hopelessness, and cast ourselves upon His mercy, upon His worthiness. Our necessity will then be God's opportunity. . . .
